ngoList.title: ASHOKNAGAR NATYAANAN
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: NATYAANAN (The Face of Theatre) was established as a there group in Kolkata, India, in 1989. NATYAANAN is an aware theatre group that believes theatre to be instrumental in bringing about social change and upholding ethical values. Consequently, â€œcorrectness of thoughtâ€ is the thriving force of the group. NATYAANAN desires to change the face of Bengali Theatre through its dogged efforts to fight against all odds to keep producing good, total, socially and politically meaningful, humane theatre. We want to ensure the survival and good health of Bengali theatre in climate where people are increasingly living life vicariously through the virtual realities of television and the internet. NATYAANAN remains rooted in the real, tied to all that is relevant to our human condition. To promote proper culture , we do workshop & production of theatre with street children , childrens of red light area.Apart from theatre WE also organize workshop of mime ,painting, patachitro( a rural Bengal art form ), clay modeling etc. with childrens of different section of society through out west Bengal. As another form of culture we also work with street theatre groups. We also organize street theatre festival in different parts of Bengal. We are now working on ATS(Alternative Theatre Space) theatre. Usually unconventional space Is the point of interest. To expand this thought to rural Bengal we do shows in villages of Bengal. During these years we have produced and staged around thirty plays (full length) , and staged around atleast 500 times in different parts of Bengal and India. The plays we staged ,are written by local, national & internationally acclaimed writer like :Monoj Mitra, Utpal Dutta, Indrashis Lahiri, Dayal Saxena, William Shakespeare, Anton Chekov, Bertolt Brechet, Eugene Oâ€Neill and many others. In the year 1999, we got an opportunity to work with 5(five) EQUITY ACTORS of U.S.A with a cooperation of TISCH SCHOOL OF THE ARTS.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Aim India Foundation is a non-governmental, non-political, non-profitable and non-religious organization, creating long lasting positive change in the lives of the poorest and vulnerable citizens of India. AIM India Foundation was established on 3rd March, 2016 by a group of Indian Development Professionals. Aim India Foundation encourages change in the mindset to tackle the structural causes of poverty, inequality and social exclusion. Recognised for the commitment to accountability, innovation and collaboration; our work takes us into the heart of the communities, where we help the under privileged and marginalised families in making them self sustainable. SOME OF THE CHARITABLE WORK DONE BY AIM INDIA FOUNDATION Children Education Initiative There are children among our community, who do not attend schools during raining season, not because they do not want to attend, but because they do not have umbrella to protect them from the lashing rain and consequent sickness. The Foundation donated 341 umbrellas to those needy school-going children dwelling in the slum areas of Kolkata. Banga Bibhushan Sri Gautam Ghosh, eminent Film Director initiated the programme. Green India Initiative Aim India Foundation has taken initiative on plantation of 25000 mangrove trees in the remote area of Sundarban which was destroyed by Cyclone Aila. Road Safety Awareness Initiative Aim India Foundation arranged a programme for creating Traffic Awareness among the children as most of them commute in the densely populated and high vehicular traffic area. The Foundation is thankful to Sri S. K. Kushvaha, Project Director, Project Implementation Unit, Kolkata, National Highway Authority of India for gracing the occasion and giving educative and practical suggestions to the children. The organisation carried out its activities with the help of donations, small trust fund and organisational core fund. In the process it reached out to well wishers, senior citizens and new sponsors.

As earlier the organisation continued to carry out its activities with active involvement of local women and with the help of donations from various sources. Moreover it disseminated information about its formation and activities through a web page created in conjunction with its two sister organisations.

Being informed through its existing network the organisation actively reached out to under served women and children to facilitate care and support services needed by them. In addition it is in the process of formulating projects which could help securing grants for community based work for women and children under government schemes. These are being pursued in continuation with its regular activities pertaining to overseeing sponsorship support for children education and development.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: ASED has spread awareness about biodiversity and its importance among more than 40,000 people in India. ASED has worked with 700 middle school students to promote biodiversity conservation in urban areas in India. ASED has created the Green Rhinos Program. From 2012 till date more than 4500 Green Rhinos have been created in NCR, Hisar, Siliguri, Kolkata, Bhitarkanika Wildlife Sanctuary, Kedarnath Wildlife Sanctuary, Sundarbans , Jaldapara National Park and Gorumara National Park.

ngoList.title: Association for Social Health In India Birbhum Pusparag Niketan
ngoList.actName: Women and Children Institute Licensing Act 1956
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Association for Social Health in India (ASHI) Birbhum Branch, Pusparag Niketan, Rampurhat, Nischintapur is one of the premier voluntary organisation established in 1993 by the eminent Social worker and freedom fighter Dr. Phulrenu Guha and Maya Ghosh to combat against immoral trafficking and other exploitation and atrocities against the women and girls in society. This organisation has been running a Short-Stay-Home since May, 1993 under the Grant-in-Aid scheme of â€œThe Central Social Welfare Board, Ministry of Women and Child Development, Govt. of Indiaâ€ and affiliated by the Association for Social Health in India, West Bengal Branch, Kolkata. It is social welfare, non-profitable and non-Govt. organization Pusparag Niketan Short-Stay-Home is a temporary shelter for women and girls in the age group of 15-35 yrs, who are victims of social and family atrocities, family mal-adjustment, discord or any in moral danger. It has considerably helped such vulnerable women and girls who are coming from weaker section of the society and different Govt. corners through Court, Local & District Administration etc. There women can stay for three years for free of cost boarding, lodging, clothing, medical treatment, protection and are helped in build-up their future through well equipped vocational trainings and employment as per their capabilities and are assisted by the key staffs of Home. The day-to-day affairs of the Home are being managed by the key staffs of Home. Home Committee/Home Management Committee of â€œShort-Stay-Homeâ€ is being formed amongst the members of the Executive Committee, Govt. Officers and key staffs of this Home Every year the members, staffs and inmates are being observed the national programmes i.e. Independence Day on 15th August and The Republic Day on 26th January with national songs. We also celebrated International Womenâ€™s Day on 8th March. There is a part-time medical Doctor, who visits once in a week, medically checked the inmates and prescribed them with necessary medicines. After admission of all inmates we made necessary arrangement for VDRL/HIV test from Rampurhat Health District Hospital at Rampurhat. We also provide Psychiatric treatment of our mentally challenged inmates at Suri Sadar Hospital Birbhum with help of the Addl. District Magistrate (Dev.) and the Sub-Divisional Officer Rampurhat Birbhum. This Home provides different trainings regularly in tailoring, knitting, embroidery etc free of cost within this Home campus under care of the trained instructors. We also provides six months vocational tailoring training out side the Home under WB State Council of technical and Vocational Education & Skill Development, Karigori Bhavan, New Town, Rajarhat, Kolkata and also the few inmates are attending College and School regularly. The Home has also provided daily newspaper. There is a local cable connection T.V. Ludo etc. and also arranged picnic and tour every year for recreation of the Home residents.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Atghara Jyoti Mohila Udyog (AJMU) led by women is a registered NGO under Society Act. (Regn. No. S/1L/34684 Dated 02/02/06). It is run to ameliorate the socio-economic status of the underprivileged women and their wards. However the organization started its operation since 7th March 1992 under the active leadership of Mrs. Nurani Islam who after prolonged struggle against poverty and various social barriers, established this organization from its burgeoning state to the present position for the betterment and welfare of the downtrodden women of the community. The Organisation has 8 work stations (i.e. Bidhannagar at Kolkata and Atghara, Hatiara, Jamalpara, Lauhati, Narayanpur, Patharghata, Raigachi at North 24 Pgs.) besides the Head Office at Atghara. We are also working at 44 villages in Rajarhat Block (North 24 Parganas), Bhangar Block (South 24 Parganas), Rajarhat / Gopalpur Municipality areas and Kolkata areas. The organization has brought about the proliferation of its activities as mentioned hereunder: 1 CAPACITY BUILD-UP At present 54 tailoring centres are functioning with 1040 trainees. More than 3000 trainees have successfully completed their courses and are engaged in various income generating ventures. The organization has also arranged for free training programmes on soft toys making / food and fruit processing for these underprivileged women community. Our products have received an excellent marketing. 2 EDUCATION Presently, two formal schools (upto the standard of Class III at Atghara (01.09.06) & Raigachi (on 02/06/08) North 24 pgs.) with a complement of 215 students and 12 Hut schools for adult education are functioning in the name of Atghara Jyoti Public Schools. The schools are awarded with special certificate of Honour â€œSchool that Caresâ€ by The Telegraph newspaper for consecutive three years i.e. 2008, 2009 (with cash prizes) & 2010. 3 MICRO FINANCE started with two SHGs known as Suryamukhi & Gandharaj, the proliferation of the activities as given below in the field of micro finance, justifies the massive contribution of Smt. Nurani Islam in building up this organization (as per the statistics of 31st July, 2010): No. of Groups No. of Members Loan Outstanding Own Savings/Deposit 1184 16234 248 Lac 184Lac 4 HEALTH SERVICES Although the prime aims of the organization is to improve socio-economic status of the poor women but our effort cannot evoke better result if proper health care services are not provided to these women. Accordingly AJMU organizes various health-care camps from where, apart from providing services of renowned doctors, free medicines are also supplied. Besides, free blood donor cards are also distributed to these women at their dire necessity.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: A.Legal Awareness Programme organised with financial assistance from the National Commission from Women. Legal Awareness Programme was organised in Murshidabad District in West Bengal with financial assistance from the National Commission from Women in 2014-15. NCW provided a financial assistance of Rs. 200000. Organised at Venue: Talgram on 14th and 15th February 2015. The objective of the Legal Awareness Programme (LAP) was to empower women and girls with the knowledge of the laws related to women, legal rights and duties, to enable them, to share power equally, gain full access to the means of development, and to inspire a whole generation of women to work together towards achieving equality and justice. B. Food Packet Distribution to Widows with Donation from Orphans in Need. Food Packets were distributed to widows with donation from Orphans in Need. In the year 2014-15, Orphans in Need provided a donation of Rs. 210000 to Bharatpur Conija Handicap School. C. Mid Day Meal Expenditure. Mid Day Meal is provided at Bharatpur Conija Handicap School. Education facility is provided to approx 100 Disabled Children. Bharatpur Conija Handicap School is working for the Disabled Children and very poor people of the community. We started a School for Physically Handicapped Children and we are also working for mentally retired children, who are mentally challenged and handicapped. An expenditure of Rs. 119300 was made on Mid Day Meal in 2014-15. D. Find Out Disabled Children Program Every year, we organise Disabled Children Programme. Through Community Survey, every year our organization finds 25 disabled children. We provide Education facility to approx 100 Disabled Children. Bharatpur Conija Handicap School is working for the Disabled Children and very poor people of the community. We started a School for Physically Handicapped Children and we are also working for mentally retired children, who are mentally challenged and handicapped. Student assessments are implemented throughout the year to evaluate continued enrolment in this program.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: We have already given home to 8 orphaned youth (all above 18 years of age), give them a homely enviroment in a kind of family, where they feel loved, cared and secure. We send them for Vocational Training, mostly in IICP, and we have already arranged job for 4 of our boys, so they draw a small salary and are very happy to prove that despite their disabilities they are a useful member of Society and have a future.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: caring for 8 handicapped abandoned youth, send the to school, Vocational Training, provide proper food and medical care and teach them Life Skills (like calender, date, money, sign reading etc)

housing and caring for 8 handicapped abandoned youth in a rented house..4 boys we send to IICP for vocational training, and for 3 boys we found already employment and they draw a small salary...we still teach them at home basic education like maths, english and bengali and keep them busy making paper bags etc

running a small home for handicapped abandoned youth, depending on local donation and member subscription. some of the boys still go to IICP for vocational training (blockprinting, lamination, paper bag making), while 4 boys are employed and draw at small salary. ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: This is a computer as well as soft skill training Institute. Nevertheless it has several motto. We mainly train computer hardware, software, Spoken English, Nursing training, Personality Development and so on. Apart from this we have a school for kids. We take special care for backward students. In this complicated and competitive society young generation getting hesitated and jobless due to lack of their skills on above mentioned matter. Therefore to make the young generation skillful we trying our level best to have many projects. Meanwhile we are going to have women skill Development programme such as tailoring, Hand craft, Embroidery and so on. Every year we arrange huge skill development programme, Seminars, Awareness camp. We also held many competitions on Drawing, Quiz Contest, Dance, Drama, Music, Recitation, Hand craft among the rural people. Our objective is not only to make the backwards but also all aged and categories people enriched, skillful and efficient. Not only that we also have several future plans. We want to serve on Medical awareness camp and programme on blood donation, AIDS, free eye test and so on. We also taking care of old aged persons. In this society they have no place, Young generation is about to forget the contribution of them. We personally are treating their problems, sufferings, troubles. Recently we conducted garbage cleaning operation with the help of young guys. Above all our service is the total development of the rural people in every corner of the interior. We want to offer a golden independent society on the palm of the government of India.
